ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to prepare clean, concise slides and present the topic of my research.
I learned SO much about effectively presenting my research!
How to make an effective scientific presentation and keep a more details and organized lab notebook.
this class prepared us very well for our senior projects; I learned how to give a good presentation and how to write proposals properly

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: One of the best MCDB courses at Yale where the professors want you to succeed yet grow at the same time. Pertinent, honest feedback, and a tight-knit community develops by the end of the course.

This course really helped me learn how to make good slides for presentations and forced me to keep a very thorough lab notebook. The latter was especially helpful because my lab notebook prior to this was kind of a mess, so I appreciate that. I think that the idea behind this course is really good and I definitely learned a lot about how to talk about my research. 

However, I found most of the lectures on techniques to be not very helpful. The class block is two hours long, and it's very hard to pay attention for that long when discussing something that is not helpful to most of the students. Again, while the idea behind these lectures is great, most of us do not use those techniques in our lab, so knowing extensive detail about them wasn't very helpful.

Strengths: Dr. Nelson and Dr. Moreno are awesome professors. They are both incredibly knowledgeable and gave thorough feedback regarding our presentation skills. Weaknesses: none that I can think of at the moment

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. You will be proud of the work youve accomplished by the end of the semester. Its a tremendous amount of growth but little at a time.

It really depends on what you're looking for. I took this class as a last minute decision because I couldn't find anything else to fit my schedule. If you want an actual hands-on bio lab, this is not it. However, if you're looking for a research for credit option that actually counts towards the MCDB major, this is a great option. I think that the organization of this course is well suited to help you improve as a scientist, but the feedback is harsh and it can be difficult to discern what is actually expected of and wanted from you at times. Again, only take this if you don't want a hands-on bio lab.

I would recommend this course to juniors who are going to complete an MCDB senior project. This course helps improve your presentation skills and writing, which are skills that are necessary for the senior project.
